customize.text:
<color=#ece5d8>The Chasm: Underground Mines, Liyue</color>
<color=#ffffff>Quest Description:</color> <color=#ffffff>Having taken out the Abyss Lectors lurking here, you discover that Zhiqiong has seen the symbols on the key-like object the Lectors left behind somewhere else...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I'm here, Traveler! The campsite's been set up, follow me!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Is it Zhiqiong's voice? It's coming from up ahead!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> How did she get in front of us... This is weird.
Quest Objective: Talk to Zhiqiong up ahead
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> It's great to see that you're alright! What... what were those two creatures? I've never seen anyone... or anything like that... *cough*
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Alright, alright, there's no need to be so strict. I won't risk provoking them, I know...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> How did you get in front of us?
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> We came through a hidden mine on the western side that just so happens to let us get around the areas infested with the black matter and the strange creatures below... *cough* Ugh...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Uhh, are you alright?
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I'm fine, I'm fine... That road was pretty hard to find and no mistake. It might've been some sort of path the Treasure Hoarders carved out en route to their loot stashes... But I can't imagine them wanting to come this far down, either...
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Well, our campsite isn't too far away. Let's talk as we go, shall we?
Quest Objective: Go to the camp with Zhiqiong
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Speaking of which, we heard a few tolling sounds, like a bell, not long after we entered the mines... and then the tunnels started collapsing!
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> We just about barely got out by running for our lives. No one was hurt, though, and our equipment wasn't damaged. We can also call for foodstuff resupply to replace the losses.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Would you happen to know anything about that, Traveler?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Hehehe, not really...
Arrive at the new camp
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> We're here! Welcome to the forward operating base of the exploration team. Feel free to rest here whenever you like!
Optional Dialogue: Talk to JInwu
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Ah, you're here. Thanks for helping us clear the path. Zhiqiong was also a big help in guiding us, as well, so thank you both.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Tell me about the camp.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Well, it looks good, eh? My specialty, by the way.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> I started learning all this from my father starting from the time I was around ten... How to set up campsites, how to make crystal lamps, how to maintain mining equipment...
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> I learned and learned, and my father grew old all the while... Eventually, when his eyesight started failing, it fell to me to maintain the safety equipment in the mine.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> And even later on... Well, as you can see, I'm not young anymore myself. As for the rest of my tale, it's not much... I found a man, lost a man, had a daughter who went off to Sumeru to study...
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Sometimes, when the men at the mines leave us early, it falls to me to take care of their kids... So I carry some sweets around all the time.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> And that's why... in my mind, kids always look this way to me: sweet-smelling, staring at me from where they are on the ground, waiting for candy or some colorful rocks to play with.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Whoa. Uh, so, do you have candy on you right now, Jinwu?
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Candy? Well, it's not the fancy type like you'd get in the city, but you're not going to be picky now, are you?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Ah, so that's the kind of candy you're talking about...
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> People come and go, leaving only memories behind to accompany me... and adventurers who go into the mines like you, of course.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Tell me a bit about Zhiqiong.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Zhiqiong's from our latest batch of miners, and she was born in Mingyun Village. To be honest, all the experienced miners at The Chasm were from Mingyun Village. Zhiqiong was just born at the wrong time.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Ah, don't get me wrong, I'm not saying that times are hard. I'm just saying that the ore veins dried up at Mingyun a good long time ago, so work there has already ceased.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Shortly after Zhiqiong came to The Chasm, the incident happened and work here stopped as well. I guess she and mining just aren't meant to be.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Uh...
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Everyone went their separate ways after that. I stayed, though — it's not as if the equipment will maintain themselves. She, on the other hand, became an adventurer.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> She hasn't grown up at all, though, and still doesn't value her life at all... or maybe she's just spent too little time down in the mines.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> I'm pretty sure that getting used to the mining life and saving a few people from perilous situations might give her a new appreciation for life.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Well, I'm not sure if I can make this request of you, but could you watch over her for me? I'd hate to see her get herself killed.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: See you.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Alright then. Take care!
Obtain

customize.name: Sugar
customize.desc: A seasoning derived from Sweet Flowers. Has the power to give both energy and happiness.

customize.text:
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Clitopho
<color=#ffffff>Clitopho:</color> Hello! How have your travels been going?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Fine, and you?
<color=#ffffff>Clitopho:</color> Thanks for giving me that opportunity back there. After our attempt to create the cannonball fuse earlier succeeded, everyone's warmed up to the idea of letting me stay.
<color=#ffffff>Clitopho:</color> As for what I'll do after getting back to the surface... Heh, I haven't thought it all through yet, but I probably won't rejoin the Treasure Hoarders!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Probably...?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Really...?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Clitopho:</color> Uh, oh, I mean, I'm definitely never rejoining the Treasure Hoarders! Definitely!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> See you.
<color=#ffffff>Clitopho:</color> Take care of yourself!
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Taliesin
<color=#ffffff>Taliesin:</color> Sorry, I'm a little dizzy at the moment, but I can take it! Ugh...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: What is it you're doing here?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Taliesin:</color> I consider myself a bard of the old school, so of course I'm here to get some inspiration.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Well! You looked pretty alright just a moment ago, and now you look like you're about to drop any second!
<color=#ffffff>Taliesin:</color> I've never gone down into a mine before... And in my hurry during in getting here, I wound up... pulling a muscle.
<color=#ffffff>Taliesin:</color> Ow ow ow...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: I won't disturb you, then.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Taliesin:</color> Agh... This medicinal oil really isn't doing it for me... Well, see you, and do come to me again when you have new stories to tell, alright?
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Khedive
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> That... *sigh* Eh? Oh. Hello. Sorry. You bothered me there.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: So, does that make us even?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Well I'm sorry that you're sorry that I bothered you.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Alright, no need to horse around. Our current situation is not good. Not good at all, really.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> You've seen that shining crystal fragment already, right? If my guess is not off, there should be an even larger one deeper down... Although I suppose you already knew that.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> In theory, our readings should have stabilized once the fragment above "returned" to its original location. And that's what happened, in fact... But the waveform is wrong... all wrong.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: What are you talking about?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Use words that I understand, please.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Not much of a student, were you? Well then, let me put this simply. We are currently akin to beans on a stone mill, on the brink of a clash between two great powers.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Albeit on a larger time scale, we are presently being crushed by these two forces — one from above and one from below — and we shall soon be turned into bean paste!
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Just wait and see if you don't believe me yet. That adventurer named Zhiqiong... Well, I've seen what happens to those who get too close to such things.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Today it's going to be coughing up blood, and tomorrow, she might just cough her innards out too.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Is there anything I can do to help?
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> You? Well, give me some time to think... There's got to some way we can...
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Well, whatever the case, what we need most urgently now is for you to continue exploring until you find out what happened down there.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Don't worry, I won't sit by and do nothing in this situation. I've got to make sure that my investments see return, after all, so I must see to the safety of the exploration team.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Will you be taking responsibility for me, too?
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Mmm, well... I have to admit that your abilities have completely exceeded my estimations. As such, I think that you're more than capable of taking responsibility for yourself.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Agh, never mind, what am I saying... If something does happen to you, I'll compensate you, okay?
Quest Objective: Talk to Zhiqiong
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> *cough* Oh, hello there. Is there something you need?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> You're coughing away! You sure you're okay?
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I'm alright, really... The air down here is just kinda thin, which doesn't sit too well with me.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Ah, yes. This is the map that I drew earlier... *cough**cough* Ugh. Well, that feels better.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Uh, you'd best rest up. Don't go running around all over the place, now!
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Speaking of maps, we've got one for you as well...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> It's a map of "The Two Strange Bells"... Seems like it's something those dastardly Fatui left behind!
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Thank you! I'll incorporate this new location into my map!
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> ...Wait a moment. Did you say "Fatui"? They've tunneled into this place as well?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Certainly looks like it.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Looks like we've got to be even more careful while exploring The Chasm...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> Speaking of which, we found this...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> You've been around here more, Zhiqiong, so you probably know what this is used for, right?
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> This? I think I found a gate with a symbol similar to this one somewhere deeper down.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> *cough* *cough* Ah, sorry. If I remember correctly, you could hear the wind behind that gate... I'm quite sure that there should be a large open space behind it for us to explore.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I wonder what relationship this thing has to that gate? Might it be a key of some sort? *cough*
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Zhiqiong's right. This is a device used to unlock the gate.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Whoa! Where did you come from?
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> A "hello" before joining the conversation might be nice.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Sorry, um... I was just too eager to say that this strange device is indeed used to open doors.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> I once looked into similar devices, and just as luck might have it, the device in your hands is an exact match to the one in my research lab.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Unfortunately, neither alchemy nor basic mechanics can help us understand the energy held within these devices, nor can they explain the principles behind their ability to unlock and lock gates...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: A research lab...?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Aren't you a paleontologist?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> We Amurta take a rather dim view of those who rely purely on theory. That said, we often have to work with those blockheads from Spantamad all the same...
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> <color=#ffffff73>*sigh</color> * Well, that's all I can tell you. There isn't much else to be said with regard to the Akademiya...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Oh, I have a pillow right here, you can keep talking...</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: You can keep going. Not that we'll understand or anything, of course.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Oh, I'll stop, I'll stop... I didn't form this exploration team to divulge all our secrets or something.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Whatever the case, if we're able to find that gate that Zhiqiong spoke of, we'll be able to use this strange device to open it.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Let's go together then, shall we? Ever since you shared this new map with me, I've been left with this last section unmapped!
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I just thought that we could... *cough* ... Whoops, sorry. You know, we could get it all done in one go! *cough* Haha... *cough* Sorry, sorry... *cough*
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> We can leave the map thing aside for now. Have you... had close contact with that black, muddy stuff at any point?
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Oh, I'm fine. The environment's just not sitting too well with me, y'know? I mean, this is nothing for a true adventurer! *cough* *cough*
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Nothing? Hey. You'd better wake up, you hear? You're the only person — I repeat, the only person in the whole team — who has shown such serious negative reactions during this process.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> We have to send you up to the surface to rest. If we go now, there's still time.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Alright, alright, don't look at me like that. Do whatever you want. It's not as if I'm your parent or something.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Will you really be fine?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> That's right, you've been coughing this whole way!
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> <color=#ffffff73>*cough*</color> I'm fine... I can take it.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Khedive, do you mind explaining?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> I'm telling you this out of the goodness of my heart. Don't take it for a reason to violate the strictures of the Akademiya.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> ...I'm sorry, I cannot divulge the details, but Zhiqiong has to get some distance from the thing under The Chasm... No, she has to leave The Chasm itself.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Wait, what... C'mon, you're talking in riddles! Are you just annoyed that Zhiqiong's not well or something?
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> She is very sick, yes, and if no one takes it more seriously, it really will be too late.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Alright, please, just stop it... *cough*
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I joined this team of my own accord. I'm not going to change my decision based on what others say.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Mm, yes. And I suppose that as an adventurer, your primary concern is the remuneration?
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> If you're willing to leave, I'll make sure you're compensated. It'll be quite the generous package. The representatives from Liyue will understand as well.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> *cough* *cough* Sorry, I'll have to excuse myself now. The area Traveler cleared out needs re-mapping. I shan't waste your time any further.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Right, Traveler. I'll head to the gate that I mentioned before later. If that's where you're headed as well, we can meet up there.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Hmph, this kid... is not to be reasoned with. At all.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> You're being too harsh on Zhiqiong, Khedive.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Exactly. You were so curt, and you didn't explain anything either. Is there any wonder that you ticked her off?
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Heh. I just didn't expect that she would have literally no concern for her life at all! ...You know what? Forget it. She can do what she wants.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> And then she'll regret it later... and ask for help. That's how young people are. Always got to take a hit or two before they learn.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> What exactly is wrong with Zhiqiong, anyway?
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> What we're facing is, in essence, very similar to the anomalies on Dragonspine, in the sense that their source is something alien to this world we know... and it involves the clash of two energies.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> And that is why we had to get you on the team, Traveler, since you are able to manipulate the elements without the use of a Vision.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> For normal people like us who neither have Visions nor can manipulate the elements, these anomalies are malignant, even fatal.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Those who have close contact with the source of the anomalies may begin to lose touch with the world. Some will weaken swiftly and even...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> So, Zhiqiong...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> ...Is in trouble.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> That's as much as I can say.
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Wait, then what are we supposed to do? Should we chase after her?
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> *sigh* It's her choice...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> But we can't just stand by and watch... We should at least try, Traveler.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Well, don't let me delay you either way. I'll leave you to your own business... There are still a great many secrets for us to discover down there.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> And... if you meet Zhiqiong, please take care of her on behalf of the rest of us.
Obtain

customize.name: Key to a Stony Hall
customize.desc: According to Khedive's initial speculations, this construct may be a "key" that could open the door to some ruin somewhere.

customize.text:
Optional Dialogue: Talk to JInwu
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Oh, you're here.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Something's been wrong with Zhiqiong lately. I suspect that it's that... tainted stuff that's affecting her mind and body.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Whatever it is, it's strikingly similar to the way in which locals here five hundred years ago described the dark calamity...
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> But today, the Yakshas are a distant memory, and Rex Lapis too has left us... I must admit that this is the most worried I've ever been for the safety of us mortals.
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Sorry... I kept you back just to tell you all this pointless nonsense. Still...
<color=#ffffff>Jinwu:</color> Never mind... You stay safe now, alright?
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Clitopho
<color=#ffffff>Clitopho:</color> Zhiqiong left just a moment ago. She seemed pretty angry about something... Do you know what happened?
<color=#ffffff>Clitopho:</color> I mean, come on! She said that she wouldn't be mad at me anymore... and yet her temper hasn't changed for the better in the slightest since coming to this campsite.
<color=#ffffff>Clitopho:</color> That Khedive guy's telling everyone that Zhiqiong's lost it and has to leave The Chasm...
<color=#ffffff>Clitopho:</color> Heh. Sounds like he's the one who needs to get his head checked.
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Taliesin
<color=#ffffff>Taliesin:</color> Phew, the swelling in my leg's gone down... as has the pain. I should probably write an epic for Liyue's medicinal oils, hmm...
<color=#ffffff>Taliesin:</color> Ah, sorry, didn't see you there — I've just been resting over here all this while.
<color=#ffffff>Taliesin:</color> If you're looking for Zhiqiong, I believe she said that she was looking for some kind of gate...
<color=#ffffff>Taliesin:</color> She said that she'd share the story of her adventure with me, too. Just head over that way, you should find her easily.
Optional Dialogue: Talk to Khedive
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> Sorry for telling you all that.
<color=#ffffff>Khedive:</color> I won't take up any more of your time... We've all got things to busy ourselves with, after all.
Quest Objective: Go to the gate that Zhiqiong mentioned
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> *cough* *cough* Hey, Traveler, you're here! *cough*
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: What are you doing here?</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: Found you.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> *cough* What's wrong? You don't look so good. Did I annoy you in some way?
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> Y'know, Paimon's having trouble telling who looks worse between the two of you...
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: The road ahead is very dangerous.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Traveler: You need to get more rest.</color>
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> You know, everyone's actually... really concerned about you. Please don't care so little about your own safety...
Zhiqiong: I... Of course I know they're worried. But it's like I said before. This is what an adventurer's life should be like!
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> No adventurers in this world would balk in the face of danger! And I have no wish to lie in bed in my dotage, withered by age, relying on others to eat or even to get myself to the toilet!
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> If the alternative is stability and boredom, I'll choose danger any day. I'd rather lay my life down here than lie in some cushy bed waiting for time to claim me.
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> I belong here. I know it. A comfy job with the Ministry? That's not for me. Khedive's Mora? It doesn't own me.
<color=#ffffff>Traveler:</color> ...
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> And as opposed to those lucky few who have Visions...
<color=#ffffff>Zhiqiong:</color> Adventure, exploration, challenge — these are things that can only be truly experienced by normal people like us!
<color=#ffffff>Paimon:</color> So when it comes down to it, it's all about you, huh? Haven't you spared a single thought for others?
